name: BEST WESTERN PLUS Blunsdon House Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having recently stay at the Blunsdon House Hotel with my wife i must say how pleasantly suprised I was with the quality on offer.
reviews.title: Fantastic place - way ahead of the other Swindon hotels.

reviews.text: I have stayed at best western hotels before now and they vary (espeically in the USA - some are downright terrible) but this "premier" tag was new to me, so i thought, "why not?" I would give it a go. Let me just tell you the premier makes all the difference! And for all the right reasons.
reviews.title: Very enjoyable stay - a home from home

reviews.text: Upon arriving we thought the hotel looked very small, but its intial apperance is deceptive - the place is huge. It has a variety of bars (3 - i think) and two restaurants offering a range of different cuisine - we ate in Nichol's "fine dining" and whilst not as haughty as some restaurants we frequent, the food was fresh, simple and tasty and the service was superb.
reviews.title: great hotel family friendly
Brilliant Blunsdon
reviews.text: The bedroom was large, comfty and modern but most importantly very clean! We opted to stay in the pavillion which is the new block of rooms but having poked my nose into another room in the main building, they were nothing to turn your nose up at either. We also had a flatscreen TV in the bedroom, a nice touch considering i only just coughed up for one at home. While their we also made use of the gym and spa facilities, which must be the biggest of any hotel in Swindon? Certainly bigger (and better) than those of the neighboring Hilton. I didnt have time to squeeze in a round of golf before i was collared for bag carrying duties at the local shopping center, but the course looked nice (our bedroom overlooked it) although quite short.

Facilities aside the biggest advantage this place has over some of the other hotels i have stayed in the area is the staff attitude, nothing is too much trouble and they really seem to enjoy their work. The Blunsdon is owned by a local family and you can really tell, it lacks the corporatety plastic welcome that alot of the bigger 4 star hotels extend but that a VERY good thing in my opinion - overall a fantasic experience.
reviews.title: Perfect for Business Trip

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel on business with a group of collegues. My room was lovely and they really think of everything. Fluffy bathrobes, coffee maker as well as kettle, flat screen TV etc. The meals I had were very good, nicest roast beef I've had in ages. Excellent selection at breakfast of continental as well as cooked items. Staff very helpful and professional. Would stay there again on business or pleasure.
reviews.title: Lovely accommodation in rural setting

reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel for a weekend, and was very impressed with the room I got, and the hotel in general. The purpose of the visit was for a bridge weekend, so I paid one fee for full board, and several bridge sessions.
reviews.title: Great hotel, but some minor service issues

reviews.text: The food was also very good, and there is a choice of bars at which to drink. So it all sounds great so far.
reviews.title: Never fails to impress

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The issues that I had were minor service issues. For instance on check in I was told that my room was 'obviously' next door to my friend's room, since our rooms had consecutive numbers. Firstly this is not obvious (could quite feeesibly be odd numbers on one side and even numbers on the other for example), and secondly the room did not turn out to be next door to my friend's.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also, on one of the coffee session, it appeared that the staff forgot to provide the coffee.
reviews.title: wonderful xmas

reviews.text: As an American business traveler I have pretty high expectations for a hotel room and in most of the UK I find it hard to meet those expectations. As a frequent guest in the UK I've learned that most hotels are older (smaller rooms - older bathrooms), less frequently remodeled and more expensive than their peers in the USA. Most also lack alarm clocks and irons in the room. I'm not making excuses; you simply can't apply USA expectations when you book rooms in the UK.
reviews.title: Stay in the new wing

likes.disliked: — The dated sink in the bathroom

reviews.text: Blunsdon House Hotel is a reasonable choice in this area and clearly it is run by a staff that cares about their reputation. It was clean and there were regular signs of a staff that was engaged. They offer a nice breakfast and the hotel's premier restaurant makes a nice meal. Having read a few reviews and now having stayed there with co-workers, it is obvious that the newer wing of the hotel is far superior to the old main building. My room was on the 3rd floor of the main building and definitely felt dated. It was a tight room that felt worn. The TV remote almost worked some of the time and most annoying was a bathroom sink with separate hot & cold faucets. These are still very common in the UK but have no place in a decent hotel. It makes shaving almost dangerous as you try to mix the hotel's "uber hot" & cold water in your hands to rinse your face.
reviews.title: Great Power Shower

likes.liked: — Proximity to Business Location Versus Other Available Acomodation
likes.disliked: — Previously-Used Sheets, Inflexibility of Hotel Staff Regarding Late Checkout

reviews.text: I liked the hotel more than my room itself. I'm not sure I would have been happy to be in that room on the weekend for leisure travel.
reviews.title: Busines Stay

likes.disliked: — Unable to get to the bar when they screened the football - not enough bar staff

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Blunsdon House Hotel while he was in Shrivenham on business.
reviews.title: Fantastic Family Facilities!

reviews.text: While I'm generally pleased with the accomodation - well, for the price, I should be - I did have a few, not insignificant, problems.
reviews.title: Not good

likes.disliked: — Very outdated, not business traveller friendly

reviews.title: Overall very good, but room like a fridge!
reviews.text: Stayed here one night on business on one of the coldest nights of the year. Reception staff very helpful upon check in. Executive room was a good size with a huge, very comfortable bed. Flat screen tv, hairdryer, trouser press (I missed an iron!) Lovely toiletries and fluffy bathrobes. My only real complaint was the fact that when I walked into the room, it was freezing cold. There were two radiators, neither of which would turn on (I suspect they are centrally controlled). I rang Reception and was promptly provided with a portable electric heater, which helped a bit. The man who brought it also came equipped with a screwdriver - I think this was more of a "Prop" to show he'd tried to fix the "problem" but I am confident pressing the central control switch would have done the job! If so, it's a bit off leaving rooms without heat when it's sub zero temperatures outside. Just something to be aware of if you stay during winter. I took room service breakfast, which was very nice and delivered on time. Overall, the stay was good but they should ensure rooms are warmed before guests' arrival. Also, the usual problem of extremely thin walls. One of my colleagues was unfortunately subjected to rather loud and inconsiderate bedroom activity from the room above, whilst I could hear "toilet" activity (the lesser of two evils in my opinion!) I would probably try another hotel in the area if staying in Swindon again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have had the most wonderful weekend break and the Blunsdon House Hotel, Everying was just PERFECT, the staff were friendly and very helpful, the room was to die for, we did'nt want to come home. We will be returning here next year.
reviews.title: Absolutely Perfect - Just Heaven, even though it was raining

reviews.text: Booked one night at this hotel as a spa break for myself and my daughters. From the moment I first contacted the hotel until our final treatment in Secrets, we were treated by all members of staff with courteous, friendly service. We were able to check in early, large rooms in The Pavilion, mine had a balcony and overlooked the golf course and countryside beyond. My girls had a ground floor room with a patio.
reviews.title: Excellent service and facilities

reviews.text: A light lunch in Carries was tasty, dinner in Christophers was buffet style which gave you the opportunity to try several dishes. The leisure centre included swimming pool, jacuzzi, steam room and sauna - all excellent and not very crowded. We even had a game of squash on the Sunday morning. The treatments in Secrets were the icing on the cake.
reviews.title: Could have stayed for longer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Extremely comfortable hotel. Excellent room, with balcony in the Pavillion, and plentiful breakfast - could have had it in room for an additional £5. Plenty to do, including Secrets beauty salon. India head Massage, just the job! Could have stayed for another couple of nights.
reviews.title: Brilliant!

description: Set in extensive private grounds of 30 acres with stunning views across to the Vale of the White Horse and the Cotswold escarpment. This very comfortable 116 en-suite, 4 Star, family owned and run hotel offers two restaurants, three bars, air-conditioning and executive room upgrades available. With extensive leisure facilities including indoor pool, 9 hole Par 3 golf course, beauty salon and much more. We are an ideal hotel for both business and leisure.
